page.title: 11WATER SUPPLY(2)
page.content:
Woodgate Hill has 2 reservoirs. The smaller of these is No.1 which holds 14 million gallons of water. No.2 is much larger. It was built in 1959 and at the time of building wasthe largest covered reservoir in Britain. It covers 10 acres and is 1215 feet by 250 to 600 feet wide. It is 20 feet deep. It has been calculated that the total excavation was about 500,000 cubic yards. To build this reservoir 24,000 tons of sand were used, 57000 tons of stone and 12500 tons of cement.
This No.2 reservoir is covered by a concrete lid which in turn is covered by a grass top. It holds about 60,000 gallons of water.
